question: Lily and Ben prepared 4/8 of an invitation. What is the fraction in its simplest form?
Mr. Johnson cut 6/12 of a sheet for Lily. What is this fraction in simplest form?
Ben used 18/36 of his paper for invitations. Simplify this fraction.
Lily had 10/20 of her invitations ready. What is the simplest form of this fraction?
Mr. Johnson cut 9/12 of a sheet for the extra invites. Simplify this fraction.
Lily realized that 15/60 of her invitations were unnecessary. Simplify the fraction.
Ben discovered he made 12/24 of the invitations incorrectly. What is this fraction in simplest form?
Lily realized that 20/50 of the invitations were damaged. Simplify this fraction.
Lily and Ben each prepared 3/4 of an invitation. How much of an invitation did they prepare together?
Mr. Johnson helped Lily and Ben by cutting 2/4 of a sheet of paper for Lily and 1/4 for Ben. How much of the sheet did he cut in total?
If Lily added the 7/9 paper of the invitation to the 4/9 she already prepared, how much of the invitation does she have now?
Ben finished 12/15 of his invitation and added it to the 7/15 he prepared earlier. How much of the invitation has he prepared now?
If Mr. Johnson cuts 14/17 of a sheet for Lily, 13/17 for Ben, and another 11/17 for extra invites, how much of the sheet did he cut in total?
Lily has 7/8 of a sheet of decorative paper left after her project. She uses 3/8 of it to make a card. How much of the sheet does she have left?
Ben had 7/6 of a large piece of construction paper. He gave 5/6 of it to Lily. How much of the construction paper does Ben have now?
At the art festival, they used 9/10 of a large roll of ribbon. If 4/10 of the ribbon was used for decorations, how much ribbon is left?
Mr. Johnson cut a large piece of paper into 15/17 pieces for the invites. If 12/17 of the paper was used for the first batch of invites, how much paper is remaining?
Lily and Ben prepared 13/14 of their invitations by the end of the first day. They managed to send out 11/14 of them. How many invitations do they still need to send?
Lily has 7/8 of a sheet of decorative paper. She receives another 3/8 sheet from Ben. After using 6/8 of a sheet for her project, how much decorative paper does she have left?
Ben has 3/5 of a jar of marbles. He buys another 4/5 of a jar of marbles at the store. After giving away 2/5 of the marbles to his friend, how many marbles does Ben have left?
